laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver echotexture is normal; no intrahepatic bile duct dilation. A well-circumscribed hyperechoic right hepatic lesion measuring 2.6 x 2.4 x 2.4 cm is predominately hyperechoic but heterogeneous in echotexture. The main portal vein is patent, demonstrating proper hepatopetal flow. The CBD measures 2 mm. The gallbladder contains multiple mobile stones measuring up to 1.4 cm. No pericholecystic fluid, wall thickening, distention, or sonographic sign. No free fluid is present. The right kidney appears normal. The pancreas is unremarkable. The aorta is normal in caliber.
